means: 打（ strike的过去式和过去分词 ）

word_mean: 〔传染性〕羊肠毒血病：小牛、小羊和小猪常见的致死性肠毒血症，由C型产气荚膜梭状芽胞杆菌引起，主要发生在冬春季，明显的全球性分布
其特征为出血性肠炎和腹膜炎。最初是英国拉姆尼沼泽地(Romney Marsh)作为成熟绵羊的一种疾病报告的

sentence.Network_en: Several hundred workers struck in sympathy with their colleagues.
sentence.Network_cn: 几百名工人罢工以声援他们的同事。

sentence.Network_en: I struck the ball cleanly and my shot was on target.
sentence.Network_cn: 我干脆利落地击球，命中了目标。

sentence.Network_en: He lost a foot when he was struck by a train.
sentence.Network_cn: 他给火车撞伤，失去了一只脚。

PerfectNetExp.abs: When meteorites have struck , they have never carried any hint of some mysterious space disease ., 当有陨石击中 , 他们从来没有进行任何暗示一些神秘太空病.

entry.def: Struck is the past tense and past participle of strike.

means.word_mean: 1. (used in combination) affected by something overwhelming;

auth_sentence.content: The ambulance service said he was struck with birdshot.
auth_sentence.res_content: The ambulance service said he was struck with birdshot.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The ambulance service said he was struck with birdshot.

auth_sentence.content: This paternalism and his personal story struck a chord.
auth_sentence.res_content: This paternalism and his personal story struck a chord.

means.word_mean: 因罢工而关闭的,受到罢工影响的
被某人/某物打动；迷恋某人/某物

sentences.en: I was struck by her youth and enthusiasm.
sentences.cn: 她的年轻热情把我迷住了。

sentences.en: We’re not very struck on that new restaurant.
sentences.cn: 我们对那家新开的餐馆不太感兴趣。

means.word_mean: (惊得或吓得等)目瞪口呆，说不出话

sentences.en: We were struck dumb at the sight of three armed soldiers in the kitchen.
sentences.cn: 看到三个持枪的士兵在廚房里，我们惊得目瞪口呆。

sentences.en: The witnesses were struck dumb with terror.
